Lightning Charges are a fantastic idea.
Instead of lightning strikes though, I think dealing lightning damage (and affecting mobs as if being struck by lightning) would be the simplest way to go about it.
Rather than crafting a Storm in a bottle, brewing one would make more sense. It shouldn't alter the weather as that is too much power for a player to have. It should simply be like an instant harm potion, except any type of mob takes damage and is affected by lightning.

Using lightning charges to craft lightning arrows would also be cool (and could be unique to the fletching table)

This almost exactly an idea I had, only I was thinking more of a lightning in a  bottle where you use a bottle on a charged creeper to get it, and it has all the same applications and like the brewing idea in the other comment instead of using it to make just one type of potion it makes a new type like dragons breath makes lingering or gunpowder makes splash potions, only it spreads the effect of the potion from one mob to another, starting strongest at the epicenter and getting weaker as it spreads farther away. If you drink it in its purest form like a potion it will "charge" you giving you slight  speed, regen, high jumping, strength, and a knock back boost but only for a short amount of time. It wouldn't restore any hunger.

The piglins might be the sworn enemies of wither skeletons, but I think it still makes sense for them to have stolen a weapon from the wither skeletons.

I like the idea, but instead of the recipe being 1 firework and 1 potion, I think it should be 1 firework and 1 tipped arrow/lingering potion. The reason being is that the way you have it, it would be a far easier way of getting lingering potion and lingering potions are an end game item.

Unlike wool, scaffolding isn't really meant to be a colorful building block. It's meant to help you build other stuff more easily. No support from me, sorry.

MacchuPicchu96, Thanks for being positive and supportive! It would just be a new colour aside to the normal. It wouldn't state a new purpose or anything; it's just for players who want to actively make attractive buildings. You never know what people want to make out of any block. So make it serve both purposes.
it's too much food so i don't agree with this but your idea about rabbit stew is nice.

At the very bottom of the article is the list of the foods that I came up with. The title that says the foods name will describe what that food item can do. I separated the foods I came up with so that you guys can tell me if you prefer one more then the other. So if you like the stew idea but if you don't like the other foods then don't vote for the ones that you don't like. You should check some of the others foods out though. Some of them are pretty amazing. Again they don't have to be all added in game, it's just the ones that you guys like the most.
Blast Burner, for the love of God, add hyperlinks to your idea lists. Nobody wants to have to search for them manually.

I'm sorry MacchPicchu but I don't know how to make links that only says the name but if you click on it, it brings the reviewer to the post.

Like this Blast Burner

And not this: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/profiles/366765816612-Blast-Burner?filter_by=activities
If you could tell me how to do that(if not I completely understand) then I would do that. If I knew how to do that I would've done that to some of my other posts including these a long time ago.

Of course! So, when you write a comment, you see a bunch of options come up, like bold and italic text, right? The option all the way on the right is the insert link option. So do this when editing your post:

1) Copy the link for the thread you want this one to link to

2) Highlight the text in this thread that you want to act as a link

3) Click the insert link button

4) Paste the link of the thread you copied in step 1

5) Repeat for all the threads you wrote.

Hope it works for you :D

I did that and this is what I got: https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360031018132-More-Foods-Enhanced-Rabbit-Stew-

I already knew how to do that however this is not was I was looking for. I wanted it so then it only says the name and then I can click on it and not the actual link itself. I'm pretty sure I did something wrong.

You're missing step 2. So let's say you want to add a link for "Blaze Cake" that goes to your blaze cake article. Highlight the words "Blaze Cake", THEN hit the insert link button, THEN copy the link into the space that pops up on the top bar (NOT into the text you're writing). See below:

Omg MacchuPicchu you're such a wingman! I just tested what you told me to do and it worked! I'm going to fix a lot of my posts tomorrow though because right now I'm exhausted from doing some research for a very special creature that you should definitely check out(if it get excepted hopefully).

Awesome, happy to be of help :D

Your post looks much better now!

And yes. Ruby (maintain the old appearance or make a new one), Amber, Amethyst, Sapphire, Block of Amber, Block of Ruby, Block of Amethyst, Block of Sapphire and other variants will be included in the next update - that's my idea.
I had the same idea, but different ambers would be cool, e.g. white, green and black. And if the ambers are found in driftwood, sand and maybe underwater.
I believe that amber can be used in redstone mechanics, as it effectively creates static electricity. Even from the ancient Greek language "electron" - amber.

Actually, Mumbo had the exact opposite idea.

 

He wanted scaffolding to be placed under a block. Not a block under scaffolding.

Actually, I thought of this one more as a command-block issue for map-makers, but not only a means to produce mining fatigue in an area (which a command block can do) but "jitter" as an effect that is the flip-side of mining fatigue: you "jitter" too much to *PLACE* a block. The Jungle and the Desert Temple both suffer from, "I know how to easily defeat these with my trusty pickaxe." When I see a Desert Temple, I know what block to hit and dig straight down until I get close enough to pop the pressure plate, loot the precious TNT, check the loot in the chests, jump-place blocks back out and I'm gone. Zero danger. With the Jungle Temple: Pick-ax everything & loot, easy-peasy.

Eldrielphor's suggestion takes care of the "pick-ax everything" problem. "Jitter" would solve the "jump-place blocks to reach things or block dangers" problem.

Adventure mode is the "easy" solution to have this for map-makers. But if we want "Survival Mode for all except THIS area" such as generated Temples and Dungeons, a better tool to do JUST THAT would let Mojang make serious, interesting, challenging new dungeons in Vanilla. Even if this is done in command-block, "Anti-grief" for limited areas in Vanilla would be a huge boon.
People could still blow stuff up with TNT.

it would be very cool if you can just place a specific block and protect a land from 40-64 radius.
basically itll just make any player to set to gamemode adventure so that theyll not gonna break stuffs
